project.teaser: With the purpose of transforming road transportation in Europe to zero-emission mobility, POWERDRIVE aims at developing next generation, highly efficient, cost-effective, and compact power electronics solutions that integrate a portfolio of technologies for multi-objective...
project.objective:
With the purpose of transforming road transportation in Europe to zero-emission mobility, POWERDRIVE aims at developing next generation, highly efficient, cost-effective, and compact power electronics solutions that integrate a portfolio of technologies for multi-objective optimisation of electric powertrains of battery electric vehicles. These integrated solutions can be applied to both low and high-performance vehicles, and they will be suitable for diverse types of electric vehicles. The concept of POWERDRIVE is that all the experience and expertise of the project partners in the development of electric drivetrain components will be leveraged and lead into the integration of advanced power electronics solutions for an optimised powertrain. This concept brings additional opportunities to strengthen Europe’s supply chain in electromobility for road transportation and to achieve zero-emission road mobility.
POWERDRIVE intends to implement innovative strategies to improve the efficiency and power density as well as to reduce the cost of electric powertrains while keeping performance high and reliable. The technologies developed in POWERDRIVE will accelerate the development and deployment of zero-emission road mobility which will deliver concrete benefits including improved quality of life, economic growth, and new business opportunities for all the EU member states. An optimised EV powertrain will significantly reduce transport emissions and tackle the issues of air quality and noise pollution in urban areas.
project.title: Power electronics optimisation for next generation electric vehicle components
project.keywords: Power Electronics, SiC, Integrated Inverters and Chargers, Real Driving Profiles

article.title: A better EV powertrain to reduce emissions

result.title: Report on topology study and inverter specifications
result.description: This report contains a detailed list of the inverter topologies found in literature (papers, patents, and commercial solutions) that can be used in POWERDRIVE. Such list will contain assessment and KPIs to help the preselection for the further tasks.Change in due date requested by Chalmers due to the following:Chalmers has initiated several concept evaluation studies with other project partners (Infineon, Rogers, and SCIRE). Since we have had a delay in the official joining of Infineon to the project, it was impossible to make sufficient progress in the concept studies. These studies will take 3-4 months to be concluded.Chalmers plans to build an intermediate 3-phase inverter prototype using HybridPack to verify the preliminary design of the inverter (gate driver, DC link capacitor stress, heat sink, and DC bus bar). The results will aid in finalizing the inverter specification. However, this activity is also affected by the official inclusion of Infineon in the project. The current plan is to have a working prototype by the end of September to Mid-October.The delay should consider the summer vacation period (July-Aug)

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
